page.title: 12DAGLINGWORTH TRANSMITTER.
page.content: The Transmitter next to Warrens Gorse house at Daglingworth is situated on high ground overlooking Cirencester about 4.5 kms from the centre of town. The mast is owned by the I.B.A and pictures are sent up to 8kms in all directions. It looks like a very tall pylon with a vertical tube at the top. It was built in 1982 and is about 35m tall. The block contains 2 garages, both are on the A435,Mosley's Garage sells Pace petrol at 199.9p per gallon, they also sell Citroen cars. Auto Garage at Perrott's Brook sells Fina petrol at 201.6p per gallon and also repairs cars. An estate of very expensive houses is hidden behind Mosley's garage. This was a pre war development and is very exclusive.
